result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin C Stuht was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Defendant must provide a DNA sample.

Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, DNA surcharge and Supervision fees.
To be paid from 25% of prison funds with balance due 1 year after release from Supervision.
Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

AODA assessment and treatment.
Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY; random urine screens.

NO association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses or drug dealing.

Consecutive to: to any other sentence at Day Reporting Center/ HOC.
Huber for work and treatment.
Electronic Monitoring

Defendant shall never possess any firearms or weapons.
Ineligible voting notice.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin C Stuht

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

COURT ORDERED Defendant to serve 6 MONTHS at the Day Reporting Center / House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 1 day time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work and treatment.

COUR ORDERED THE FOLLOWING CONDITIONS:
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, and DNA fees due up to 25% of prison funds with the balance due 1 year after release of supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Electronic monitoring.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment and treatment.
*  Random urine screens. No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealing.
*  MUST provide a DNA sample.
*  As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons.

Received and filed with court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement Form

Defendant Justin C Stuht in court with attorney Russell J Jones.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found Defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.
Defendant Justin C Stuht in court with attorney Russell J Jones.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Justin C Stuht in court with attorney Russell J Jones.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Justin C Stuht in court with attorney Russell J.A. Jones.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE. cmt  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 04/04/2014 @ 1:00pm
